Judul: Crystallization of ? versus ? Phases in Syndiotactic Poly(styrene-stat3-methylstyrene) and Poly(styrene-stat-4-methylstyrene)
Abstrak:
By incorporating different levels of methyl groups at meta- or para-positions (3- vs 4-methylstyrene) as
comonomer units into syndiotactic polystyrene (sPS), we examined the effects of comonomer structure/content on the
polymorphic behavior. Upon melt-crystallization, wide-angle X-ray scattering (WAXS) profiles revealed that syndiotactic
poly(styrene-stat-3-methylstyrene) (sPS-3MS) formed predominantly ?-crystals for 3MS content up to 11 mol %, followed by
dominance of ?-crystals at a higher 3MS level (21 mol %); in the case of syndiotactic poly(styrene-stat-4-methylstyrene) (sPS4MS), predominant formation of ?-crystals occurs only at 2 mol % 4MS content, followed by dominance of ?-crystals at higher
comonomer levels (5 and 10 mol %). Upon cold-crystallization, both sPS-3MS and sPS-4MS consistently gave only ?-crystals. It
appears that the formation of ?-phase is consistently preferred in these random copolymers. WAXS profiles showed that the
characteristic reflections generally shift to lower q-positions with increasing comonomer content, i.e., crystals in copolymers
have greater unit cell parameters, except for the ?-structure of sPS-4MS. Hence, comonomer units are believed to be
incorporated into ?-crystals in both sPS-3MS and sPS-4MS or ?-structure in sPS-3MS but fully excluded from the ?-structure of
sPS-4MS. Results of molecular mechanics computation showed that the packing energy increases upon incorporation of
comonomer units, the effect being particularly strong for ?-crystals of sPS-4MS. The significantly suppressed formation of ?crystals in sPS-4MS may thus be simply attributed to the strongly increased interchain packing energy due to the protruding 4-
methyl groups; this steric repulsion is weaker for ?-crystals in the sPS-3MS series, consistent with the delayed preference of ?crystals to higher 3MS contents.
